column4: I need help getting my blackberry bluetooth phone syn in ubuntu. I already fallow my howto by installing gnome-blue and obex-vfs-ftp something, but still can't access phone. The error message I get when trying to connect is could not display obex:///xxxx with also a message want me to tried select another viewer. Any I dea here and your help is appreciated.
I have a blackberry pearl 8100
the blackberry is not syncable with linux, there are tools in development but they are quite beta
oh now you tell me
you tried it before?
I did some big research into it before purchasing a black berry and decided against it for this very reason
it uses a propriatary bluetooth stack and the cable is not standard even for sync
sorry to bring you bad news
well it seem it work when connected with usb cable directly.
really ? you can sync it with the cable, I read it as a diffeent pin out
actually is like a media, or reconize as storage, but I can that a different matter of a sort
yes, it will see it as a dumb disk
shouldn't be syncable though
(unless you use the development tools, which where hit and miss when I tried them with my demo phone)
well suck for my blackbery
I know - it's bad news, there is a protest filed with rim over it, but nothing will be changing
don't feel like getting another phone and I still like my blackberry
I concur - I liked mine, but swapped it within 14 days due to this problem
what phone work with ubuntu?
nokie E71
that was my replacment for the blackberry bold, just as good, smaller lighter and supported with linux
no idea
thank for the help and info. Now I'm going to get my finger reader working
